snippet.textDisplay:
After this interview I waited awhile before commenting publicly to really understand how I felt about this interview. I've come to the decision that it was in extremely poor taste for Gayle King to so grossly disrespect a man who can't even defend himself. Kobe Bryant was 41 years old when he did. The subject that Gayle King brought up happened almost 21 years ago!!!!!!!!!!! Kobe Bryant was 19-still a teen!!!!!!!! Words can't even express how so very disappointed I am in Gayle King and how so much respect I've lost for you because of this interview.
Gayle King is a woman of a particular age now are you telling me that she is not aware of the fact we ALL make mistakes because we're all born into sin as humans. Rather than applaud and commend Kobe for all of the positive and good things he has accomplished and done in his short life (especially in view of the fact that he has only passed away a few weeks ago) Gayle would rather reach back 21 years to to an unfortunate event. An unfortunate event Kobe has sincerely apologized for and turned his life around.
Gayle King are you the type of woman who is so unforgiving that you will hold a persons feet to the fire indefinitely, regarding their past mistakes? Even in death? If so, behind your very well manicured persona is a tormented and miserable woman who live in the depths of darkness
What I really wonder most ,Gayle, is when you stated that Kobe past of 'infidelity' is complicated? Is it really 'complicated' or are you just making it 'complicated' due to maybe your own unresolved issues with infidelity and catching your ex husband in bed with another woman? Were you just projecting? I wonder....may be you couldn't stick it to your ex husband, the black man, the way you would have wanted to but you certainly have a platform to stick it to other black men accused of infidelity? Just wondering?

snippet.textDisplay: I’m more disappointed in CBS as a network for allowing the 17 YEAR OLD RAPE TOPIC to even be considered “relevant” to this type of interview! This wasn’t some segment on “60 Minutes” where they reveal information on purpose to publicize controversy. This was to be a remembrance interview from the perspective of a very good friend (nothing more) and Gayle should’ve kept it there. If CBS scripted those questions for Gayle to ask, then that was Gayle’s  chance to demonstrate she had some sort of evaluation filter to take a stance with CBS and say NO NEED TO GO THERE! Now if the rape accusation was an area that Gayle herself chose to chase, then she blew it by derailing the intent of the interview. The rape topic completely changed the dialogue of the interview leaving Leslie to state the obvious about media conduct. This also showed me the level of acknowledgement for this point in time (2020 not 2003) and the respect each of the ladies had for Kobe. +1 for Leslie and -0 for Gayle.

snippet.textDisplay: Gail is only human . Looking at this situation from all perspectives,  I think she was just doing her job as journalist. She went in a little hard, but honestly she knew she was talking to his good friend,  and that it was unlikely that she was going to say anything negative about Kobe. Despite what some people may think of the interview, she wasn't truly looking for negativity.  She just touched base on the subject that there has been some controversy on within the media. She asked Lisa does this effect his legacy in the WNBA in which Lisa responded that he had respect for woman. Yes, she could have made a better choice not to mention this sensitive subject at all, but she shouldn't be crucified for it. The allegations were unfortunately apart of his past, as well as his good deeds. I think if she had been interviewing someone that would possibly have something negative to say, then it would be more appropriate to criticize her. Kobe legacy is not tarnished by her questioning his friend.
snippet.textOriginal: Gail is only human . Looking at this situation from all perspectives,  I think she was just doing her job as journalist. She went in a little hard, but honestly she knew she was talking to his good friend,  and that it was unlikely that she was going to say anything negative about Kobe. Despite what some people may think of the interview, she wasn't truly looking for negativity.  She just touched base on the subject that there has been some controversy on within the media. She asked Lisa does this effect his legacy in the WNBA in which Lisa responded that he had respect for woman. Yes, she could have made a better choice not to mention this sensitive subject at all, but she shouldn't be crucified for it. The allegations were unfortunately apart of his past, as well as his good deeds. I think if she had been interviewing someone that would possibly have something negative to say, then it would be more appropriate to criticize her. Kobe legacy is not tarnished by her questioning his friend.

snippet.textDisplay: When people let unbelievable stuff fly out the trap, I try to understand their train of thought.  I consider myself to be intelligent. After the question, nothing good could follow Gayle. Nothing. I don't agree with the death threats or other extremist activity she faces now. But perhaps you should've thought about backlash Gayle. Your questions were just very disrespectful and stupid two weeks after he passed. Stupid. And Oprah, wrong is wrong. Don't expect empathy or sympathy for her. Do you see what's happening to her now? You're not exempt from the same backlash.

snippet.textDisplay: Dear Kobe Bryant fans, I have paid tribute to the late Kobe Bryant on other YouTube uploads. Regarding the rape allegation against Bryant. Kobe Bryant never had the chance to clear his name! Kobe's lawyer, Pamela Mackey, said the accusers name in open court "SIX" times during one hearing!!! She should have been disbarred for that!!! The accusers name was then leaked to the press, by the court system, three times. The media camped outside the home of her parents! Because of the harassment, she finally decided to drop the criminal charges and received a civil settlement. As a result, there was a cloud permanently over Kobe Bryant's head thanks to his corrupt lawyer!!!
snippet.textOriginal: Dear Kobe Bryant fans, I have paid tribute to the late Kobe Bryant on other YouTube uploads. Regarding the rape allegation against Bryant. Kobe Bryant never had the chance to clear his name! Kobe's lawyer, Pamela Mackey, said the accusers name in open court "SIX" times during one hearing!!! She should have been disbarred for that!!! The accusers name was then leaked to the press, by the court system, three times. The media camped outside the home of her parents! Because of the harassment, she finally decided to drop the criminal charges and received a civil settlement. As a result, there was a cloud permanently over Kobe Bryant's head thanks to his corrupt lawyer!!!

snippet.textDisplay: 3:52

Gayle, I understand that you are a journalist but you are a human first. Compassion during a time where people are grieving was needed the most! Out of respect for Vanessa and Kobe's children that remain alive, you had a responsibility to promote healing during a time of death. People can't discern right from wrong anymore and you should not have mentioned a time in Kobe's life where charges were dropped. The man grew from past mistakes and spent the rest of his life trying to make a positive influence on the lives of many people. Kobe apologized to the young woman who accused him of rape, as he believed the act of sex was consensual. Kobe cheated on his wife and the woman knew that Kobe was married. Kobe grew and worked on being a better man, husband, and father. Humans make mistakes. And, Gayle, you made a mistake that promoted harm to a grieving family and fans. Gayle, you need to apologize for asking a question during the worst time in a grieving families life. Gayle, you need to grow and take accountability for displaying lack of compassion. Gayle, you are old enough to discern right from wrong. You don't go for the juggler during a time of grief! Put your big girl pants on and apologize to Vanessa, Kobe's children, and the fans of Kobe! Do the right thing! Yes, Gayle, you are human and you make mistakes!

Nurse, Lois
snippet.textOriginal:
Gayle, I understand that you are a journalist but you are a human first. Compassion during a time where people are grieving was needed the most! Out of respect for Vanessa and Kobe's children that remain alive, you had a responsibility to promote healing during a time of death. People can't discern right from wrong anymore and you should not have mentioned a time in Kobe's life where charges were dropped. The man grew from past mistakes and spent the rest of his life trying to make a positive influence on the lives of many people. Kobe apologized to the young woman who accused him of rape, as he believed the act of sex was consensual. Kobe cheated on his wife and the woman knew that Kobe was married. Kobe grew and worked on being a better man, husband, and father. Humans make mistakes. And, Gayle, you made a mistake that promoted harm to a grieving family and fans. Gayle, you need to apologize for asking a question during the worst time in a grieving families life. Gayle, you need to grow and take accountability for displaying lack of compassion. Gayle, you are old enough to discern right from wrong. You don't go for the juggler during a time of grief! Put your big girl pants on and apologize to Vanessa, Kobe's children, and the fans of Kobe! Do the right thing! Yes, Gayle, you are human and you make mistakes!

Nurse, Lois

snippet.textDisplay:
Gayle is off base with her questioning. But I don't think she had any ill intentions. We are destroying her but not holding the network accountable who not just clipped the interview but also aired it. Especially at a vulnerable and sensitive time as this. My line of questioning would have been...
As a friend how did Kobe bounce back to become who he became after such a dark time in his life.
How as a friend did you support him and his family during this time because most people wouldn't have been able to bounce back to become as great a player father community supporter as Kobe had become.
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: Gayle King was way out of line. She is now trying to blame CBS about putting out the questions before the interview.  She had to have seen the questions before she interviewed his long time friend.  I applaud Lisa on her comment; that the media had plenty of time to ask him when he was alive. Now he is gone and can't talk for himself,  she all of a sudden want to talk about the past. Let him and his child rest in peace, and be respectful of his family and friends.
